description: From earlier heben, hebeny, from Middle English ebenif, hebenyf (influenced by Late Latin hebeninus), from Ecclesiastical Latin ebenius (“of ebony”), from Latin hebenus (“ebon tree”), from Ancient Greek ἔβενος (ébenos), from Egyptian hbnj,

adjectives.description: ebony (comparative more ebony, superlative most ebony)

entries.meaning: Dark-skinned; black; especially in reference to African-Americans.
examples: Want to watch my gorgeous ebony friend, Almond Joy, naked and online 24/7? She recently ended a long-term relationship and is now fully enjoying being a 25 year-old single gal in Beverly Hills.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) A hard, dense, deep black wood from various subtropical and tropical trees, especially of the genus Diospyros.
(countable) A tree that yields such wood.
(countable and uncountable) A deep, dark black colour.
(slang, countable) A black key on a piano or other keyboard instrument.
